author: Erich Schwartzel
title: Fed’s John Williams Sees Three or Four Interest-Rate Increases in 2018
text:
LOS ANGELES—San Francisco Fed President John Williams said Friday he could see the central bank raising short-term interest rates this year by as much or more than it did last year, amid a brightening economic outlook.
The Federal Reserve raised its benchmark short-term rate three times in 2017 to a range between 1.25% and 1.50% and in December penciled in three moves in 2018.
